title: Task 1: Describe visual and/or contextual elements of the work shown.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe a visual and/or contextual element of the work shown.
Response accurately describes ONE visual and/or contextual element of the work shown.

title: Task 2: Describe ANOTHER visual and/or contextual element of the work shown.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately describe ANOTHER visual and/or contextual element of the work shown.
Response accurately describe ANOTHER visual and/or contextual element of the work shown.

title: Task 3:  Explain how the work is characteristic of art in the first half of the twentieth century C.E. using specific visual evidence.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use specific visual evidence to explain how the work is characteristic of art in the first half of the twentieth century C.E.
Response accurately uses ONE specific visual evidence to explain how the work is characteristic of art in the first half of the twentieth century C.E.

title: Task 4: Explain how the work deviates from the established traditions of Western visual art using specific visual evidence.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use ONE example of specific visual evidence to explain how the work deviates from established traditions of Western visual art.
Response accurately uses ONE example of specific visual evidence to explain how the work deviates from established traditions of Western visual art.

title: Task 5: Explain how Stepanova’s choices about style OR content in the work represent the ideas and values of the society in which it was made using specific contextual evidence.
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response. Each point is earned independently.
descriptions: Response does NOT accurately use ONE example of specific contextual evidence to explain how Stepanova’s choices about style OR content in the work represent the ideas and values of the society in which it was made.

Response accurately use ONE example of specific contextual evidence to explain how Stepanova’s choices about style OR content in the work represent the ideas and values of the society in which it was made.
